names.pinyin: jia zhuang xian mian yue he ji

actions: Tonifies Qi and Blood, promotes urination and reduces edema.
With Dang Gui, for Qi and Blood Deficiency.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold, reduces swelling, expels pus, generates flesh and alleviates pain.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
Clears Heat and cools the Blood.
With Bai Shao, for Blood Deficiency Heat.
Nourishes the Blood, calms Liver Yang and Liver Wind and alleviates pain.
With Chai Hu, for flank pain due to Liver Qi Stagnation.
Invigorates the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis, cools the Blood and reduces abscesses.
Clears Liver Fire, clears Hot Phlegm and dissipates nodules.
With Chai Hu, for neck nodules due to Liver Qi Stagnation.
Spreads Liver Qi, relieves Stagnation, disperses Wind-Heat and resolves Phlegm and congestion.
With Bai Shao, for Liver Blood Deficiency with Liver Qi Stagnation.
Calms the Liver, benefits Yin, anchors Floating Yang, softens hardness and dissipates nodules.

syndromes: Qi and Blood Stagnation with Qi and Blood Deficiency and Phlegm

symptoms: Sides and ribs distended on both sides (maybe with sharp pain)
Breast distention and pain before and during menses
manifestations.tongue: Dark purple (maybe purple spots on edge of tongue)
manifestations.pulse: Wiry, choppy and slow or Wiry, choppy and slippery
